intro: Susum malayanum f. sylvaticum, commonly known as the wild betel vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
